goal.en: "Based on the concept of information management, this course introduces the application of information technology (IT) in the business. Using the introductory cases (module one), the course firstly identifies the concept of data, information and knowledge, and then highlights the idea that the application of IT in the enterprise should well consider the alignment of technology, business strategy and organization (module two). The course introduces the emerging IT infrastructure and database systems. In it, several different data-models will be presented, and the topics refer to Data-Warehouse, Big-Data will be introduced. Again, the software ORACLE, SAP-HANA, IBM-Bluemix for the data resources management in the business will be introduced (module three and four). Based on the database systems, the information systems in the enterprise will be introduced in the module five. In it, the Transaction Processing Systems (TPS), Process-control systems, Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), MRP, MRP-II, manufacturing information systems, Computer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM), functional business systems in terms of accounting, human resources management, product development management, marketing management systems, etc. will be presented. Regarding the E-Business systems, the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Supply Chains Management (SCM) systems, as well as Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems will be introduced based on the SAP software. Plus, the E-Commerce systems will be introduced in terms of business model and success factors and development of web-based marketplace. (module six and seven) Decision Support Systems (DSS), Executive Information Systems (EIS) and Knowledge Management (KM) systems will be presented in the module eight. The application of some up-to-dated intelligent methods will be discussed. The module nine introduces the methodology for building information systems in the enterprise. In the final module, we will discuss the Industrie 4.0 based on the theories of management information systems. Progress in this course is application-oriented. Each course unit is accompanied by at least one case analysis or reading/discussion assignment. The concepts, frameworks and methods used in management information systems are first introduced, and are then the application to the industries are discussed."

content.en:
"I. Introductory Cases
II. Concept of Management Information Systems
2.1 Data, information and knowledge
2.2 Information systems in Business
2.3 Alignment of information systems, strategy and organization
III. IT Infrastructure in the Business
3.1 Computer hardware
3.2 Computer software
3.3 Telecommunications and networks
Case Discussion: Information systems in business
Reading + Discussion: Moore’s Law
IV. Database resources management
4.1 Concept of database management systems
4.2 Database structure: Relational data model
4.3 Database structure: Object-oriented data model
4.4 Architecture of database: Distributed and centralized
4.5 Data Warehouse
4.6 Data-mining and business intelligence
4.7 Big-Data
4.8 Software for Big-Data: SAP-HANA and IBM Bluemix
4.9 Data governance in the business
Exercise: Relational data model
Reading + Discussion: Big-Data
V. Information Systems in the Business
5.1 Concept of information systems
5.2 Classification of information systems
5.3 Transaction processing systems
5.4 Process control systems
5.5 Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES)
5.6 MRP and MRP-II systems
5.7 Manufacturing information systems
5.8 Accounting information systems
5.9 Product development management systems
5.10 Human resources management systems
5.11 Marketing management systems
Exercise: Application of information systems in the business
Reading + Discussion: Case study
VI. Enterprise Information Systems
6.1 Problems in the functional business systems
6.2 Concept of E-Business
6.3 Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems
6.4 Supply Chains Management (SCM) systems
6.5 Customer Relationships Management (CRM) systems
6.6 IT-solutions for the business
Case Discussion: E-Business for the manufacturing enterprise
VII. E-Commerce Systems
7.1 Concept of E-Commerce
7.2 E-Commerce framework and processes
7.3 Business models of E-Commerce
7.4 Success factors of E-Commerce
7.5 Web-based store
Case Discussion: E-Commerce for the consumer goods
VIII. Information Systems for Decision Support and Knowledge
8.1 Decision Support Systems (DSS)
8.2 Executive Information Systems (EIS)
8.3 Artificial intelligence technologies in business
8.4 Data-mining and business intelligence
8.5 Knowledge Management Systems (KM)
Case Discussion: Computer-based ware room in business
IX. Building Information Systems in Business
9.1 Strategic planning of information systems
9.2 Methodology of information systems development
9.3 Software maturity model: CMMI
9.4 IS service model: ITIL
9.5 Information systems project management
9.6 Implementation of software package in business
9.7 Information systems success model
9.8 Economic evaluation for information system
X. Industry 4.0
10.1 Technologies and framework to Industrie 4.0
10.2 From production automation to intelligent industry
10.3 Re-engineering of industrial process
Reading + Discussion: Industrie 4.0 = CIM 2.0?
XI. Term Projects and Discussions"
